class.name: TableBuilder
class.brief_description: A class that helps you with building and running database backend specific sql for creating / altering / deleting tables.
class.description: A class that helps you with building and running database backend specific sql for creating / altering / deleting tables. It contains helper methods that lets you run the finished query directly See [method run] and [method run_query]. You should not allocate this directly, instead get it from you active database connection, like: [codeblock] var conn : DatabaseConnection = DatabaseManager.ddb.get_connection() var tb : TableBuilder = conn.get_table_builder() [/codeblock]

method.name: auto_increment
method.description: Adds an [code]AUTO_INCREMENT[/code] statement. Equivalent to: [codeblock] result += "AUTO_INCREMENT " [/codeblock]

method.name: ccreate_table
method.description: Closes a [code]CREATE TABLE[/code] statement. Equivalent to: [codeblock] result += ");" [/codeblock]

method.name: cdrop_table
method.description: Closes a [code]DROP TABLE[/code] statement. Equivalent to: [codeblock] result += ";" [/codeblock]

method.name: create_table
method.description: Adds a [code]CREATE TABLE[/code] statement. Equivalent to: [codeblock] result += "CREATE TABLE " + name + " ( " [/codeblock]

method.name: date
method.description: Adds a [code]DATE[/code] field statement. Equivalent to: [codeblock] result += name + " DATE " [/codeblock]

method.name: defval
method.description: Adds a [code]DEFAULT[/code] statement. Equivalent to: [codeblock] result += "DEFAULT '" + val + "'" [/codeblock]

method.name: drop_table
method.description: Adds a [code]DROP TABLE[/code] statement. Equivalent to: [codeblock] result += "DROP TABLE " [/codeblock]

method.name: drop_table_if_exists
method.description: Adds a [code]DROP TABLE IF EXISTS[/code] statement. Equivalent to: [codeblock] result += "DROP TABLE IF EXISTS " [/codeblock]

method.name: foreign_key
method.description: Adds a [code]FOREIGN KEY[/code] statement. Equivalent to: [codeblock] result += "FOREIGN KEY (" + name + ") " [/codeblock]

method.name: integer
method.description:
Adds an [code]INTEGER[/code] field statement. Equivalent to: [codeblock] result += name + " INTEGER ";
if (length != -1): result += "(" + str(length) + ") " [/codeblock]

method.name: next_row
method.description: Go the the next row (field) in the current sql statement. Equivalent to: [codeblock] result += ", " [/codeblock]

method.name: not_null
method.description: Adds a [code]NOT NULL[/code] statement. Equivalent to: [codeblock] result += "NOT NULL " [/codeblock]

method.name: null
method.description: Adds a [code]NULL[/code] statement. Equivalent to: [codeblock] result += "NULL " [/codeblock]

method.name: primary_key
method.description: Adds a [code]PRIMARY KEY[/code] statement. Equivalent to: [codeblock] result += "PRIMARY KEY (" + name + ") " [/codeblock]

method.name: real_double
method.description: Adds an [code]DOUBLE[/code] field statement. Equivalent to: [codeblock] result += name + " DOUBLE " [/codeblock]

method.name: real_float
method.description: Adds an [code]FLOAT[/code] field statement. Equivalent to: [codeblock] result += name + " FLOAT " [/codeblock]

method.name: references
method.description: result += "REFERENCES " + table + " (" + name + ") ";

method.name: run
method.description: Run the query currently stored in the result property. Use this if your query returns values from the database (an you want to read them).

method.name: run_query
method.description: Run the query currently stored in the result property. Use this if your query doesn't return values from the database (or you don't want to read them if it does).
